dataList.content: We came upon a monumental castle of ice, flanked by frozen pillars that seemed to boast an indestructible durability.
Before it stood a person…
A man with hyaline hair, clear as ice, waiting for us.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I'd come here whenever I felt the need to clear my thoughts. Though there are no armchairs or that whiskey you like…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: ... the chill dominating this place pierces even the thickest coat. That helps me think with a more lucid mind.
While the rest of us were frozen stiff, stuck watching, Rodya made a slow step forward to face him.
Didn’t expect you to get here first.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: My men and I knew of a shortcut leading here.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It was a route we learned by parlaying with the local lowlives in our search for the whereabouts of a great, buried power waiting to be used for our noble purpose.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Alas, we... could only make it as far as this place, the general vicinity of the buried Golden Bough; we could not get any closer to it.
Thought you'd never leave District 25, but seeing you resorting to those tactics like some kind of gangster... Maybe you should've stayed a country boy.
Sonya, your lackeys have been taking from shopkeeps who weren’t even rich to begin with.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: … Want to know something, Rodya? This cave used to be nothing more than a peculiar hollow whose walls were lined with hoarfrost.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: And look at it now. A giant castle, surrounded by thick columns of ice, has risen here.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: This change happened the instant you walked in.
… Sounds like you figured this would happen on my arrival. How’d you know?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I have many sources… But that’s not for you to know, Rodya.
What makes you say that I caused this in the first place? I’m not some kinda witch of the Backstreets or anything.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I think the answer to that should become quite obvious once you observe those faces encased in ice.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Take a peek. They’re the ones you loved yet secretly contemned, are they not?

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: That’s all it’s worth? You can't be serious…

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: Oh, I am dead serious. Just look at how old and battered it is—it's scratched all over, and any shine it once had has long dulled.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: To be frank, others wouldn’t pay more than 200,000 for this.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: And the rest… All worthless garbage.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: With that, your remaining unpaid tax is now down to 400,000 Ahn.
Why do the poor only grow poorer the harder they work?
It’s ridiculous, isn’t it? As the pawnbroker's vault grew fuller with each passing day...
... our neighbors only grew more gaunt, forced to give up even their precious mementos and cherished memories to be weighed for pocket money upon her ruthless scale.
Sonya rallied people, delivering speeches using big words.
They organized a group under the name of the "Yurodiviye."
It went okay at first. Sonya's words managed to inspire even the thickest folks to help the impoverished of the Backstreets.
But I could see it on Sonya's face that he still wanted something more.

Eventually, the Yurodiviye that was first established to actually go out and help the needy was warped into an organization full of passive pundits who only cared about sitting around and endlessly debating how the streets and the Nests were to be revolutionized.
That’s why I left them.
Being an armchair revolutionary wasn’t going to feed our starving neighbors!

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But I told you time and time again, Rodya. That we must wait for the right moment.
Sonya, I’m sorry, but that “moment” you kept talking about…
It didn't come when little Ivan, Yurodiviye's youngest... dug through trash for food waste just to recall what having food in his stomach felt like...
Nor did it arrive after he choked to death from it.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Detailed policy plans and the power to realize them are both necessary in monumental endeavors such as ours—the redistribution of wealth.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Such personal grievances and tragedies will inevitably occur as the wheel of progress turns.
Personal? Don't you remember how it all began? Helping people was our purpose!
You and your Yurodiviye no longer seemed interested in doing that, nor in anything I'd hoped for when we began.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Is that why you decided to take matters into your own hands?
Absolutely. What our town needed…
... wasn’t an empty promise telling people to sit on their hands and wait for some vague "moment,"
but someone willing to pick up the axe.
It must've been one of those days when most of the neighborhood hadn't seen even a glimpse of food for at least 4 days.
But the biting wind hounded and howled without mercy, clawing at the cracked skin of people who barely had any energy left to even move.
And I happened to know whose safe kept so much money that she could treat my neighbors to a three-day-feast and not even make a dent.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: So, what did you do?
… No, wait. I don't think I want to do this anymore.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: The Golden Bough has resonated with your psyche and has created this confessional of sorts, just for you.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: And a confessional’s purpose is to lead a sinner to the path of penance.
If only that old woman had changed her mind in her last moments…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But Rodya…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You must have known that a terminal leech upon her neighbors wouldn't turn over a new leaf just like that.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You knew she wasn’t the kind of person who’d give up that life for that of a generous philanthropist.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You wouldn’t have brought the axe otherwise.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: Poor Rodion, dear, you seem to be under the delusion that you’re some sort of savior…

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: Demanding my money so brazenly to my face won’t change anything.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: You're nothing but a louse yourself, no different from the paupers in the Backstreets.
That’s right.
I’m the one who put an axe through her head.
Like cutting open the belly of the goose that laid golden eggs, I cleaved into that hag’s skull.
I mean, someone had to do it. Am I wrong?
Unlike the idiot cottager in the fable who gave in to greed and severed his own future prospects…
... we were just hungry, miserable people who would've gladly scooped out her brains for a meal.
And unlike the goose, her “belly” was full of golden eggs.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Yes, the old lady you killed was a tax collector wielding considerable authority in District 25.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But what gave her so much power… was her sibling’s status as a member of The Middle.
I… I put an axe through her skull for my neighbors, so that they wouldn't starve to death. Was that so wrong?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: No, you did that for yourself.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You couldn’t stand the fact that you weren’t anyone special.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Did you know? The Middle… never forgets, never forgives anyone who has wronged their family.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: They aren’t too interested in finding out exactly who did the deed; what matters to them is that they demonstrate clearly what happens to the poor fools that dare to disturb them.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: The joy of the Backstreets residents, who'd tasted the tenderness of quality meat for the first time in their lives, soon made corpse towers of them all.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Not much different from the car pagodas outside the casino.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I’m well aware of the sheer weight of pain and guilt you’ve been burdened with ever since then.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It can't have been easy to live with the realization that, at the end of the day, you really weren't so different from the idiot who cut open the goose that laid golden eggs.
Since that day… Nothing I held truly felt like it was mine.
It's all... all my fa—

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It's okay, Rodya.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You see, Rodya...

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: ... I've perused hundreds of books and thousands of documents...

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: ... and met all kinds of people around the City, all to change the world.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Change the world so that the oppressed can be free from the exploitative dominion of the ruling class and find liberation in the truest sense.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: And I want to make that world a reality.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: However, I learned that such a world cannot be realized by changing what is already here. Once ink makes its mark on a page, it is permanent; you can't simply put the ink back in the pen.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Look closely. This is the world you and I can usher in.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: A world… that can be created using the Golden Bough with which you resonated.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: May no soul on this earth suffer from starvation ever again.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: May every individual have the right to pursue their delights, both spiritual and intellectual.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: … Join hands with me, and I’ll gift you that world.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It would be as if everything that has happened... hasn't happened at all.
Ah.
Who could ever understand such a feeling?
Even the briefest glimpse of that world felt so dreamlike.
I wanted to etch that mesmerizing instant into my memory so I wouldn't forget it—not even for a second.
If this were a dream, let my sleeping self never wake and join the residents of the dreaming world.
But, despite everything…
Sorry, I’m still turning down your offer.
How should I put this…
I don’t wanna bask in the warmth just yet. I feel like I oughta be shivering in this cold a bit longer.
Think I’ll stay this way, at least until I can answer whether I deserve to be warm again.
Besides, Sonya…
You knew my temper would get the best of me and make me kill her, didn’t you?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Rodya, this will probably elude you, but you don’t have the Sign.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I came here hoping to see you possess it, but I’m seeing it on a few of your friends instead.
The Sign? What do you…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: On top of that, you can’t even see the Sign. In other words… you don’t have what it takes to lead.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But I’m different. So, to make a better world—
Yeah, yeah. I think I remember hearing ya say something like that a while ago, sitting atop a desk buried in piles of books.
…That’s why I can’t join you.
I still believe that your big words and endless debates won't ever feed the neighbors.
And as I’m sure you’ve learned by now…
There’s no way a rowdy rascal like me would fit under some dweeb’s leadership, right? Hahah!

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: The Golden Bough awaits inside the castle, Rodya.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I hope you’ll be able to find what you seek.
We walked past Sonya, and then made our way into the icy castle he indicated.
